intro: Epilobium ozanonis, commonly known as the Ozano's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, often saline soils. The plant features showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often reddish in color. Epilobium ozanonis is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species known for their ornamental and ecological significance.
